thread.title: Will Boston break its record high for today?
thread.title_full: Will Boston break its record high for today? - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Will Boston break its record high for today?
text:
Google+
Jessica Rinaldi/Globe staff
Greg Carolan, of Melrose, took advantage of the warm weather at Lynch Family Skate Park in Cambridge.
By Aimee Ortiz Globe Staff February 23, 2017
The weather gods continue to smile on New England, so get ready for more sunshine and possibly some record-breaking warmth today.
Thursday’s looking at a high of about 63 or 64 degrees, with the temperature dropping to the mid-40s tonight, according to National Weather Service meteorologist Bill Simpson.
Advertisement
The record for high for today, which was set in 1990, is 65 degrees. The normal temperature is about 40 degrees.
To the west and to the south of Boston, two cities stand a chance of breaking their record high temperatures.
Get Fast Forward in your inbox: Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email. Simpson said Worcester has a record high of 61 degrees, and Thursday’s weather looks to be gearing up to hit that mark. Additionally, Providence’s record high of 60 could also be broken today.
View Story It will be in the 60s today. What happened to winter? Something not very wintry has been going on this month to our west and south and it’s about to make a push into Southern New England.
“Those two are vulnerable,” Simpson said.
All this warm weather is causing the snow to disappear . The lack of snow is evident all across the upper Midwest and even now here in Southern New England. Folks who usually would be able to use snowshoes and cross-country skies can’t find any powder at all. The only bright spot for snow fans is in Northern New England, especially Maine, where snow has been abundant this winter. Related It will be in the 60s today. What happened to winter?
Globe Correspondent Dave Epstein contributed to this report. Aimee Ortiz can be reached at aimee.ortiz@globe.com . Follow her on twitter @aimee_ortiz .
